content: For those following along, the primary care IG build can be found at http://build.fhir.org/ig/aehrc/primary-care-data-technical/index.html. Its very, very preliminary at present
@Brett Esler It has your sample patients in it, FYI. They have a few issues in the build logs, that we're looking at
I like the ethnicity extension - it would be good to find a non-oridashi (perhaps abs or something?) url for it and add it into AU base
cool- some tips: turn off the snapshot generation in Forge; put a root element (Patient) in (can do this by putting in a short description or any change in Forge) - IG builder likes that for display

have any good terminology for ethnicity?

At the clinical meeting, someone (?Frank Pyefinch maybe) recommended an ABS set. Not sure which one though. Possibly 1249.0 - Australian Standard Classification of Cultural and Ethnic Groups (ASCCEG), 2016
https://www.abs.gov.au/AUSSTATS/abs@.nsf/DetailsPage/1249.02016?OpenDocument
I think that's the same ABS source as Brett had in his sample patient?
(and Yes, it was Frank who mentioned that)
@Brett Esler good tips, thanks. Ontoserver needs the snapshot for validation, I think, but I can put the differential-only one in the IG
I have a suspicion that skipping the snapshot generation will also avoid the problems I was having with url elements having examples that aren't valid urls
The IG builder will expand them itself.
I'm cutting a CodeSystem version of it this morning, should be done soon
Although one of the motivating cases for its clinical use was Ashkenazi, which isn't in there

think there is a case for having NCTS terminology for this - start with ABS equivalents then can add to it - ABS sets cannot be added to easily as it is externally controlled - we had a similar issue for ANZSCO and decided to maintain a new value set for roles

I'm happy to follow whichever pattern people think is best. For the moment I'm just using it as practice for adding new things into the PC profile, but it probably should move to base, with terminology in the NCTS in some guise
